instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMBUS_BATT_SCL: What is SMBUS_BATT_SCL? SMBUS_BATT_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message:
i have board i have problem to fix . Long time not been here so i decide to ask for help.
pin 27-28 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> -20.5 ohm
<RESISTOR>R7047</RESISTOR>-10.5 ohm
<RESISTOR>R7031</RESISTOR>- 10.5 ohm
J6950 - pin 9,8,7   0.2v    pin 6 and 4    3.4v
what should i check. Help please

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message: Green light present? PPBUS without battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.33v  and green light on charger. also motherboard is powering no problem

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message: 12.3 is too low and the SMC is not talking to the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. Disconnect the battery indicator cable to rule that out as a problem. See if PPBUS comes up to 12.6V now. If not do a diode mode reading on both data lines going to the battery.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message: i measure board outside case on table so only magsafe is connected. so from what point should i measure to with point . i take it red probe will need to be on ground?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message: Measure <SIGNAL>SMBUS_BATT_SCL</SIGNAL> and SDA on the battery connector. Diode mode with red on GND of course.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message: That seems close enough. What are the voltages there?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message: That is also ok. Check PPBUS again if it really is 12.23 or 12.56V. If you press the battery indicator do the LEDs light up?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message: i connected charge and pressed battery connector but no light at all

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message: This seems like a bad SMC...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message: Either a bad SMC or <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> at this point.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no charging
threads.message: ok. i replaced SMC chip and is working great. Thank you for help . Much appriciate
